title: Wall St. Rises in Day of Unsteady Trading as Global Markets Drop
summary: Economic and trade tensions drove global markets lower, while United States stocks moved from gains to losses and back again.

title: India’s Top Central Banker Quits as Government Seeks More Control
summary: Urjit Patel resigned on Monday after the Modi government sought to loosen loan restrictions and spend some of the central bank’s cash reserves.

title: Investors Have Nowhere to Hide as Stocks, Bonds and Commodities All Tumble
summary: For the first time in decades, every major investment has fared poorly. The question is whether trouble in the markets will undermine economic growth.

title: Wall Street Hits New 2018 Lows as Fed Decision Looms Over Markets
summary: Stocks slumped through the afternoon, with the S&P 500 at its lowest point for the year and most sectors affected by the sell-off.

title: The Holiday Air Travel Forecast Calls for More People, but Better Screening
summary: Improved screening equipment, additional flights and bigger planes to accommodate all the travelers should help. And then, there are the T.S.A.’s dogs.

title: Wall Street Stocks Inch Higher as Crude Oil Tumbles
summary: The S&P 500 hit its lowest point in 2018 on Monday. An early rebound off those lows faded as energy stocks declined on Tuesday.

title: Stock Markets Are Wild, but Bond Markets Can Be Dangerous
summary: The sell-off in stocks isn’t the only ominous economic sign emanating from financial markets. The bond markets, much more closely linked to the actual economy, are also flashing a warning.

title: Oil Prices Plummet 7% on Fears of a Glut
summary: Higher production than expected in Russia and the United States suggest that an OPEC deal to reduce supply might not do enough to stabilize prices.

title: Stocks Tumble After Fed Signals More Rate Rises in 2019
summary: Stocks in the United States rose ahead of the Federal Reserve’s decision Wednesday, but those gains faded after the central bank raised rates.

title: Investors Are in Retreat, and the Poorest Countries Are Paying for It
summary: As the Federal Reserve raises rates, global investors are pulling their money from emerging markets, damaging the world’s most vulnerable economies.

title: Wall St. Tumbles, Bothered by the Fed and Government Shutdown Fears
summary: Investors were disappointed by the Federal Reserve’s signals on future interest rate increases. The looming threat of a U.S. government shutdown didn’t help matters.

title: Selling Real Estate in Russia? Are You Crazy?
summary: Sellers must prove their sanity and agents kill their clients to steal their properties in Moscow’s fraud-plagued real estate market.

title: Stocks Bounce Back From Edge of Bear Market
summary: Shares had their best day since 2009, but the S&P 500 is only back to where it stood on Dec. 20, and still on pace for its worst annual performance since the financial crisis a decade ago.

title: Stocks Wobble as a Bumpy Week on Wall St. Comes to a Close
summary: A muted session on Friday contrasted sharply with trading during the rest of the holiday week, when stocks rose or fell sharply — sometimes doing both the same day.

title: Stocks Rise as Wall St.’s Terrible December Comes to a Close
summary: December will be the market’s worst month since the financial crisis, with the S&P 500 down more than 9 percent.

title: Volatility Continues as Rising Oil Prices Help Wall St. Erase Early Losses
summary: Weak manufacturing data from China soured investors, pushing global stock markets lower. But rising shares in energy producers overcame those losses.

title: U.S. Auto Sales Put Up a Big Number, but Show Signs of Strain
summary: The industry sold more than 17 million vehicles for the fourth straight year. But it is relying more on fleet sales, and economic winds are not favorable.

title: Stocks Surge as Powell Signals Fed Flexibility and Jobs Data Eases Worries
summary: Investors were heartened after the Fed chairman, Jerome H. Powell, said policymakers would adjust plans as data warranted, and a report showed robust job growth in December.

title: Netflix’s Bow to Saudi Censors Comes at a Cost to Free Speech
summary: The decision to remove an episode from its service in Saudi Arabia raises questions of whether entertainment giants will fight for values like free expression.

title: For Wales, Nuclear Plant Would Mean New Jobs. For the U.K., It May Mean More.
summary: A nuclear power facility proposed for a rugged coastline stretch could lift the local economy while expanding Britain’s non-carbon fuel options.

title: Investors Were Spooked About Profits. Now Come the Facts.
summary: After the worst year for stocks in a decade, investors are eager to hear what executives expect in 2019 as companies report fourth-quarter earnings.

title: Nobel Peace Prize Winners Demand Global Action on Mass Rape
summary: At an awards ceremony, Nadia Murad and Dr. Denis Mukwege bluntly condemned global inaction over the use of sexual violence as a weapon of war.

title: Beyoncé, Bhangra and a Bill in the Millions: The Wedding That Has India Obsessed
summary: Isha Ambani, the daughter of one of Asia’s richest men, is marrying a childhood friend in Mumbai on Wednesday. The weeklong celebrations are on a scale rivaling royalty.

title: How McKinsey Has Helped Raise the Stature of Authoritarian Governments
summary: At a time when democracies and their basic values are increasingly under attack, the iconic American company has sometimes served clients in ways that directly counter American interests.

title: China’s Detention Camps for Muslims Turn to Forced Labor
summary: Mounting evidence suggests ethnic minorities caught in the mass internment drive in Xinjiang are being assigned to new factories making clothes.

title: That Punishing Blockade? ‘We’ve Moved On,’ Qatar Says
summary: After its larger neighbors began a blockade of the tiny Gulf state, Qatar retooled its economy, beefed up its military and adjusted to the new reality.

title: It Doesn’t Matter if Ecuador Can Afford This Dam. China Still Gets Paid.
summary: A giant dam was supposed to help lift Ecuador out of poverty. Instead, it’s part of a national scandal, and a future tethered to China.

title: Sudanese Protests, After Days of Violence, Turn Anger Over Bread Toward Bashir
summary: President Omar Hassan al-Bashir’s government is facing a crisis of legitimacy, analysts say, with inflation that leaves some Sudanese spending 40 percent of their incomes just on bread.

title: Iran’s Economic Crisis Drags Down the Middle Class Almost Overnight
summary: Between inflation and a currency collapse, lives have been turned upside down, seemingly overnight. Many blame the government — and President Trump.

title: Guatemala Cautious on Young Migrants’ Deaths, Wary of Angering U.S.
summary: Guatemalan officials’ courting of the Trump administration may explain their muted response to the deaths of two children in U.S. custody.
